content.query:
-- This is auto-generated code
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://devsynapseaccount01.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-dataset/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]


-- use it the format of abfss

-- This is auto-generated code
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-dataset@devsynapseaccount01.dfs.core.windows.net/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set 
N'Select top 10 *
from 
OPENROWSET(
    BULK  ''abfss://nyc-taxi-dataset@devsynapseaccount01.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/calendar.csv'',
    FORMAT = ''csv'',
    PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) as [result]'



SELECT
    LEN(MAX(date_key)) as date_key,
    LEN(MAX(date)) as date,
    LEN(MAX(year)) as year,
    LEN(MAX(month)) as month,
    LEN(MAX(day)) as day,
    LEN(MAX(day_name)) as day_name,
    LEN(MAX(day_of_year)) as day_of_year,
    LEN(MAX(week_of_month)) as week_of_month,
    LEN(MAX(week_of_year)) as week_of_year,
    LEN(MAX(month_name)) as month_name,
    LEN(MAX(year_month)) as year_month,
    LEN(MAX(year_week)) as year_week
from 
OPENROWSET(
    BULK  'abfss://nyc-taxi-dataset@devsynapseaccount01.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/calendar.csv',
    FORMAT = 'csv',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) as [result]



SELECT
*
from 
OPENROWSET(
    BULK  'abfss://nyc-taxi-dataset@devsynapseaccount01.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/calendar.csv',
    FORMAT = 'csv',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    )
    WITH
    (
        date_key INT,
        date date,
        year smallint,
        month smallint,
        day smallint,
        day_name varchar(15),
        day_of_year smallint,
        week_of_month smallint,
        week_of_year smallint,
        month_name VARCHAR(15)
    )
     as [result]


EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set 
N'SELECT
*
from 
OPENROWSET(
    BULK  ''abfss://nyc-taxi-dataset@devsynapseaccount01.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/calendar.csv'',
    FORMAT = ''csv'',
    PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    )
    WITH
    (
        date_key INT,
        date date,
        year smallint,
        month smallint,
        day smallint,
        day_name varchar(15),
        day_of_year smallint,
        week_of_month smallint,
        week_of_year smallint,
        month_name VARCHAR(15)
    )
     as [result]'


SELECT
*
from 
OPENROWSET(
    BULK  'calendar.csv',
    DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_dataset_raw',
    FORMAT = 'csv',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    )
    WITH
    (
        date_key INT,
        date date,
        year smallint,
        month smallint,
        day smallint,
        day_name varchar(15),
        day_of_year smallint,
        week_of_month smallint,
        week_of_year smallint,
        month_name VARCHAR(15)
    )
     as [result]

CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_dataset_raw
WITH (

    LOCATION = 'abfss://nyc-taxi-dataset@devsynapseaccount01.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/'
)

Select 
*
from OPENROWSET
(
    BULK 'vendor_unquoted.csv',
    DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_dataset_raw',
    FORMAT = 'csv',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE

) as vendor

/* Escapechar will be used when there is comma within your data and you can skip it using escapechar */
Select 
*
from OPENROWSET
(
    BULK 'vendor_escaped.csv',
    DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_dataset_raw',
    FORMAT = 'csv',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
    ESCAPECHAR = '\\'

) as vendor


/* Filedquote is also other way to have comma included within the column and you can skip it using Fieldquote. Default is double quote */
Select 
*
from OPENROWSET
(
    BULK 'vendor.csv',
    DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_dataset_raw',
    FORMAT = 'csv',
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
    FIELDQUOTE = '"'

) as vendor
